abstract: ESPN sportscaster Curt Schilling, who was pulled from games after he posted tweet disparaging Muslims, is to be replaced by Olympic softball player Jessica Mendoza for Cubs-Dodgers game; Mendoza is first woman to call MLB game for network.
lead_paragraph: Mendoza, a gold medal-winning Olympic softball player, will fill in Sunday for Schilling, who was pulled after a controversial Twitter post.

headline.main: Jessica Mendoza to Replace Curt Schilling for ESPN Broadcast
headline.print_headline: Sports Briefing | Television; Softball Olympian to Replace Schilling

snippet: Mendoza, a gold medal-winning Olympic softball player, will fill in Sunday for Schilling, who was pulled after a controversial Twitter post.
